item.title: Andrea add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "No sympathy for the devil; keep that in mind. Buy the ticket, take the ride...and if it occasionally gets a little heavier than what you had in mind, well...maybe chalk it off to forced conscious expansion: Tune in, freak out, get beaten." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Andrea add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Hell is empty and all the devils are here." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "Everyone thinks of changing the world, but no one thinks of changing himself." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "A man can live and be healthy without killing animals for food; therefore, if he eats meat, he participates in taking animal life merely for the sake of his appetite. And to act so is immoral." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "He had the unlucky capacity many men have of seeing and believing in the possibility of goodness and truth, but of seeing the evil and falsehood of life too clearly to take any serious part in it." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "Why does an apple fall when it is ripe? Is it brought down by the force of gravity? Is it because its stalk withers? Because it is dried by the sun, because it grows too heavy, or because the boy standing under the tree wants to eat it? None of these is the cause.... Every action of theirs, that seems to them an act of their own freewill is in the historical sense not free at all but is bound up with the whole course of history and preordained from all eternity." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Andrea add a quote by John Keats
item.description: "I am certain of nothing but the holiness of the Heart's affections and the truth of the Imagination." -- John Keats

item.title: Andrea add a quote by John Keats
item.description: "Nothing ever becomes real 'til it is experienced." -- John Keats

item.title: Andrea add a quote by John Keats
item.description: "I almost wish we were butterflies and liv'd but three summer days - three such days with you I could fill with more delight than fifty common years could ever contain." -- John Keats

item.title: Andrea add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "Bran thought about it. 'Can a man still be brave if he's afraid?' 'That is the only time a man can be brave,' his father told him." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Scott Westerfeld
item.description: "Sometimes the facts in my head get bored and decide to take a walk in my mouth. Frequently this is a bad thing." -- Scott Westerfeld

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Scott Westerfeld
item.description: " I love you all. But it's time to say good-bye, for now. be careful with the world, or the next time we meet, it might get ugly. -Tally Youngblood" -- Scott Westerfeld

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Scott Westerfeld
item.description: "Having a brain hurt so much sometimes." -- Scott Westerfeld

item.title: Andrea add a quote by D.T. Suzuki
item.description: "The truth of Zen, just a little bit of it, is what turns one's humdrum life, a life of monotonous, uninspiring commonplaceness, into one of art, full of genuine inner creativity." -- D.T. Suzuki
